docs.snippet: A memoir by Auma Obama, a half-sister of President Obama, will be published in the United States in May, St. Martin's Press said on Tuesday. The book was released in Germany last fall with a title that translates as ''Life Always Gets in the Way''...
docs.lead_paragraph: A memoir by Auma Obama, a half-sister of President Obama, will be published in the United States in May, St. Martin's Press said on Tuesday. The book was released in Germany last fall with a title that translates as ''Life Always Gets in the Way'' or ''Life Happens.'' Ms. Obama was born in Kenya and first met her younger brother in the 1980s, after which they traveled to Kenya and researched their family history together. She lived in Germany for 16 years and now works in Nairobi for CARE International. ''In this candid and emotional memoir, Auma shares her own story as well as recollections of and experiences with her famous brother,'' said a statement from St. Martin's, part of Macmillan.
docs.abstract: Memoir by Auma Obama, half-sister of Pres Barack Obama, will be published in United States; photo (M)

headline.main: Another Obama's Memoir Is Coming to the U.S.
